command.simpleclouds.direction.get: Clouds are currently moving in direction [x: %s, y: %s, z: %s] (%s)
command.simpleclouds.direction.set: Successfully set cloud direction to [x: %s, y: %s, z: %s] (%s)
command.simpleclouds.scroll.get: The current cloud scroll position is [x: %s, y: %s, z: %s]
commands.simpleclouds.notClientSideOnly: Client cloud commands can only be used when connected to servers that do not have Simple Clouds installed. If you're connected on singleplayer, or you are an operator on a dedicated server with Simple Clouds installed, please use '/simpleclouds clouds'
gui.simpleclouds.cloud_previewer.info:
Welcome to the cloud previewer!

Add, remove, and customize noise layers seen in the left of the screen to create custom cloud types. Use the load button in the bottom right to load existing cloud types to edit them, and use the export button to export your cloud types as JSON files.
gui.simpleclouds.cloud_previewer.popup.e: What would you like to name your cloud type?
A file with that name already exists. Would you like to override it?
Your cloud type has been exported to %s
gui.simpleclouds.cloud_previewer.title: Cloud Previewer
gui.simpleclouds.config.clientSideCloudH:
Specifies the render Y offset for the clouds.
Range: 0 ~ 2048
gui.simpleclouds.config.clientSideCloudM: Specifies how the clouds should behave. DEFAULT uses all cloud types with the default weather in Simple Clouds. SINGLE uses only a single cloud type and its associated weather. AMBIENT disables localized weather and carves clouds around the player, keeping them at a distance. Please note that while on a server without Simple Clouds installed, DEFAULT will not work and the mod will instead pick AMBIENT. If Simple Clouds is installed on a server, this option will be ignored and the client will instead use the option set by the server.
gui.simpleclouds.config.clientSideSingle: Specifies the cloud type that should be used when the SINGLE cloud mode is active.
Client Side Single Mode Cloud Type
gui.simpleclouds.config.clientSideSpeedM:
Specifies the movement speed of the clouds.
Range: 0.1 ~ 32.0
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudMode.descri: Specifies how the clouds should behave. DEFAULT uses all cloud types with the default weather in Simple Clouds. SINGLE uses only a single cloud type and its associated weather. AMBIENT disables localized weather and carves clouds around the player, keeping them at a distance
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudMode.title: Cloud Mode
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudSeed.descri: Specifies the seed to use for the clouds. Will apply for all servers that the user connects to with the mod on the client-side only.
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudSeed.title: Cloud Seed
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudStyle.descr: Specifies the visual style of the cloud. DEFAULT is the default style. SHADED adds minimal shading to clouds, making them appear more defined.
gui.simpleclouds.config.cloudStyle.title: Cloud Style
gui.simpleclouds.config.framesToGenerate:
Specifies how many frames it should take to generate the entire cloud mesh. Higher values will improve performance at the cost of some visual artifacts.
Range: 1 ~ 32
gui.simpleclouds.config.frustumCulling.d: Culls cloud chunks not visible to the player. Disable if facing noticeable artifacts with high cloud mesh generate times.
gui.simpleclouds.config.generateMesh.des: Toggles the generation of the cloud mesh.
gui.simpleclouds.config.levelOfDetail.de: Specifies the quality of the level of detail.
gui.simpleclouds.config.renderStormFog.d: Specifies if the fog beneath storm clouds should appear or not. Disabling can improve performance.
gui.simpleclouds.config.showCloudPreview: Specifies if the info pop-up should appear when opening the cloud previewer menu.
gui.simpleclouds.config.singleModeCloudT: Specifies the cloud type that should be used when the SINGLE cloud mode is active
gui.simpleclouds.config.singleModeFadeEn:
Specifies the percentage of the cloud render distance that the clouds will be fully faded away, when using the single cloud type mode (e.x. 50 would make the clouds completely disappear past half the cloud render distance).
Range: 0 ~ 100
gui.simpleclouds.config.singleModeFadeSt:
Specifies the percentage of the cloud render distance that the clouds should begin to fade away, when using the single cloud type mode (e.x. 50 would start to make the clouds fade away at half of the cloud render distance).
Range: 0 ~ 100
gui.simpleclouds.config.stormFogAngle.de:
Specifies the angle parellel to the horizon that the storm fog should be directed to.
Range: 50.0 ~ 90.0
gui.simpleclouds.config.testSidesThatAre: Specifies if faces that are not visible to the camera should be tested during mesh generation. Settings this to off can improve performance at the cost of some visual artifacts.
Specifies if the seed set by the 'Cloud Seed' option should be used or not.
gui.simpleclouds.debug.title: Simple Clouds Debug
gui.simpleclouds.requires_reload.info: A config option was modified that requires resources to be reloaded. Would you like to reload resources?
gui.simpleclouds.unknown_cloud_type.info:
Unknown cloud type '%s'. Please pick a valid cloud type.

Valid cloud types are as follows:

%s
simpleclouds.config.preset.fast_culled_m: Heavily lowers the total vertex count by applying culling. Generates the cloud mesh much faster. A small delay for chunks to appear is present when turning fast.
A more complete cloud mesh that fairs better with storm fog. Removes the small delay for chunks to appear that can be seen when using frustum culling, however at the cost of more vertices. Clouds may appear to move with a slight stutter when moving fast.
